title: River Mckegney
text: I’m an undergrad Marine Science (MSCI) major, into researching all about the majestics of underwater creatures and their environment. I also like growing plants!

title: River Mckegney
text:
Academics

Monterey Peninsula College | Monterey County, CA
Associates in Science: General Studies in Natural Science | 2017-2023
California State University Monterey Bay | Marina, CA
B.S. in Marine Science | 2023-Present

title: River Mckegney
text:
Experience
I do dynamic services for property maintenance promoting health & well being of surrounding wild habitats/ecosystems and the land owners. I am involved in the regulation and moderating the interface between people’s space and the wilderness’ space to accomplish peoples dreams with intention to foster environmentally friendly and inclined judgement in the decision making process. I conduct projects involving fire clearance, processing firewood, tree pruning/removal, invasive species removal, and general landscaping work.

Coastline Gardening Service, Carmel CA | 2020-present

I also like growing plants! I propagate many native species for fun, like Yerba buena which I also use to make tea with. My garden contains a growing collection of Sarracenia. Here’s an S. leucophylla:

title: About
text:
About this site:
How’s it! My name is River, I am an undergraduate student at CSUMB majoring in Marine Science. I grew up here in Monterey all my life, and am stoked to have spent much of my time along the coast and in the water with my family. I enjoy surfing, diving, fishing, and exploring nature. I also got a garden and grow lots of sarracenia, yerba buena tea, and more!
